title: Why do my jaws and teeth hurt when I try to sing higher notes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hurting of jaws to hurting of teeth is a whole world of probabilities. Could be a gum or a jaw problem, depending upon the amount of energy and force you are using for the two kinds of music. Your jaws and teeth can hurt coz of excessive opening of the mouth and pressure on the joints when you are fry screaming, higher energy exhaled out of vocal chords exhausting the muscles of the oral cavity and can also be due to exposed roots of the teeth. Get your jaws (clicking and joint) and gums checked.
